channel.title: Benefit of using GameFrame?
channel.description:
Hey, I'm pretty new to RSC server emulation, but old to RS cheating (bovine labs, autorune, RSCN days), so sorry about the noob question.
I was browsing through the Havokonline client source that I downloaded from these forums, and as far as I can tell this is how it's setup: [img]http://i43.tinypic.com/2a8rtyu.jpg[/img]
My question is: if it's displayed in a browser, what is the benefit of using GameFrame? Or is this client's source setup to not be displayed in a browser? It seems like what GameFrame is doing could easily be done by the GameWindow it's composed in.

item.title: Benefit of using GameFrame?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Yeah that might be true. But then it also might be made that way so that Jagex’s staff can run it via a client, and not in an Applet. If that is not the case either, I honestly don’t know.

Read full topic

item.title: Benefit of using GameFrame?
item.dc:creator: @Jonesy1128 Jonesy1128
item.description:
@Jonesy1128 wrote:

[quote=“xEnt, post:3, topic:251431”][quote author=ephemeral link=topic=331879.msg2591181#msg2591181 date=1229770151]
I am sure they made it so you can run it both as an Applet and as a java.awt.Frame so that people can run the client that they provided on their downloads-page (or wherever it is stored now).
[/quote]
That client they had was basically just a web browser, with no navigation but runescape.com.
it did still play through an applet i believe.[/quote]

Correct. I recall it vibrantly, exactly the same as the website, also, I do believe they even had in the description browser without all the clutter, no address abr and such. I’m also fairly certain it required you had internet explorer.

Read full topic
